unjust killing.
And we should also notice that it is not at all plain that this argument re-
ally does go even as far as it purports to. For there are cases and cases, and
the details make a difference. If the room is stuffy, and I therefore open a
window to air it, and a burglar climbs in, it would be absurd to say, “Ah,
now he can stay, she’s given him a right to the use of her house—for she is
partially responsible for his presence ther
